title: Could you please help ASAP
content:
HCould you please help me identify this font ASAP need to get something done but not sure what it is thought it might be futura but doesnt have the pointy bits like furtura.

Appreciate you help

V

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317102825im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Screen%20shot%202015-01-04%20at%208_4857.59.12%20AM.png)

Font: 

 Avenir 

Solved By: 

 [riccard0](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317102825/http:/typophile.com/user/46071 "View user profile.")
author: vlaverick

comments.content:
It seems that it is called Avenue heavy [http://www.weddingpaperdivas.com/product/16758/signature\_foil\_wedding\_in...](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317102825/http:/www.weddingpaperdivas.com/product/16758/signature_foil_wedding_invitations_elegant_exchange.html "http://www.weddingpaperdivas.com/product/16758/signature\_foil\_wedding\_invitations\_elegant\_exchange.html")

As found it on this page... but cant seem to find a font that matches it on the internet?? any suggestions

V
This is a strictly volunteer board and a free service, so invoking ASAP really isn’t appropriate here....
Thank you for your help :) appreciate it greatly :)

I believe "Avenue" is actually a name the invitation company gave to "Avenir".

- Lex
